nameEntry.part: State Archives and Records Authority of New South Wales
State Records Authority of New South Wales
Archives Authority of New South Wales

biogHist.abstract: The State Archives and Records Authority of New South Wales was established in 1961 by the Archives Act, No 46 of 1960 and is responsible for collecting, managing and preserving New South Wales Government records. In 1999 the State Records Act 1998 came into effect, replacing the Archives Act 1960. Prior to 1961, archives were kept at the Public Library of New South Wales. In mid-2012 the search room at The Rocks was closed and all material and staff were based at the Western Sydney Records Centre.
biogHist.p: The State Records Authority website includes access catalogues, guides and fact sheets, search indexes of names and places and browse our online galleries.
In 1999, the State Records Act 1998 came into effect and Archives Authority of New South Wales became known as State Records Authority of New South Wales.
On 25th October 2016, a change in name in the State Records Act 1998 (the Act) was approved and the organisation's name changed to State Archives and Records Authority of New South Wales.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Records relating to Child and Youth Migration, New South Wales (c. 1919 - c. 1974)
New South Wales State Archives Collection (1788 - )
Department of School Education, State Government of New South Wales (1989 - 1997)
Department of Education, State Government of New South Wales (1915 - 1989)

descriptiveNote.p: Some records from the Department of Education are managed by the State Records Authority.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Department of Education and Training, State Government of New South Wales (1997 - 2011)

descriptiveNote.p: Some records from Parramatta Girls Industrial School are located at State Records.
Some records from Parramatta Girls Training School are located at State Records. Permission is required from the Department of Community Services to access these records.
The State Records Authority of NSW holds some records relating to Mittagong Cottage Homes and the Mittagong Farm Homes, and has some relevant indexes.
Some records of Parramatta Girls Training Home are held at State Records. Permission from the Department of Community Services is required to access some of these records.
